Open topic with navigation

Properties Dialog

Diagnostic Console » Properties Dialog

 

The Diagnostic Console display can be specified further in this dialog.

The individual sections have the following meaning:

Services

Here is where to set whether the Diagnostic Services will be displayed with their name and/or their qualifier (function name in the database).

Example

Name: Variant Coding
Qualifier: VARCODING

With the Prefix option you can switch on/off the display of the index and of the Service or Local IDs. When both options are activated, the index is displayed first (left), followed by the ID's and the name.

In addition the sort order of the single services inside the sections and in the drop-down selection field can be set to alphabetic order or according to the Service or Local IDs. The index is not re-numbered; every element keeps its own index.

Columns

The column Optional Parameter Columns lists all parameter properties that can be displayed; the desired property can be transferred from them to the section Displayed Parameter Columns via the [Add] button. Any property you like in this column can be removed from the display with the [Delete] button.

Note

These displays only provide information and cannot be changed, because the Diagnostic Console has no write access to the database.

The name and value of the parameter are always displayed. The value can be changed, because it is stored not in the database but in the controller.

Options

  • Initialize parameters automatically
    When this option is activated, the values of the corresponding Write parameters are updated with the values from the controller every time the write service is selected in the Diagnostic Console. This corresponds to an automatic execution of the Initialize parameters command.

Note

During initialization the values of all the parameters of the respective write service are overwritten by the values from the controller.
  • Display parameter position/length in the Trace area
    This options controls the display of additional properties of the parameters.
  • Display constant response parameters in the Trace area
    Parameters set as constant in the diagnostic description are displayed at responses although they dot change their values.
  • Suppress Positive Response Message (UDS)
    When this Option is activated the display of positive Response messages in the Trace area (the lower part of the Diagnostic Console) is turned off.

Note

The option only works if it is supported by the respective service in the diagnostic description. Otherwise the option is inactive.
  • Fill string parameters with spaces
    String parameters can be set in the diagnostic description to a constant string length. When in the Diagnostic Console a parameter with a shorter string length is input, the remaining space is filled with the "blank" character to avoid compatibility conflicts.
  • Display PDUs in the parameter list
    This option displays/hides the raw messages in the parameter list. (PDU=Protocol Data Unit)
  • Maximum number of requests in the history
    Here you can set how many requests are displayed in the history list (available via the button in the toolbar). Maximum number is 64.

Logging File

Via the button [File...] the name and the directory where the logging data are to be written can be set. As default the name traceLog.txt is suggested. Because the settings are stored when the program is closed this option is activated at a re-start. In this case the logging data are appended on the existing logging file. The logging is activated and deactivated with the button in the toolbar.

Note

When you switch off the option and switch it on again the content of the previous logging file will be overwritten with the actual data without any user information.
